definition: palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to grasp (often fig.)/to control/to seize (initiative, opportunity, destiny)/to master/to know well/to understand sth well and know how to use it/fluency
to know sth like the back of one's hand (idiom)/to know (a person, a place etc) inside out
variant of 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
fig. to rub one's fists and wipe one's palms (idiom)/to roll up one's sleeves for battle/eager to get into action or start on a task
to clap one's hands/to clap each other's hands/high five

sentences.english: She manoeuvred her friends into positions of power.
sentences.chinese: 她設法使她的朋友們掌了權。

sentences.english: The three of them applauded, Isabel clapping her thigh.
sentences.chinese: 她們三個鼓起掌，伊薩貝爾拍拍她臀部。

sentences.english: Extend the life of shoes by repairing the  soles.
sentences.chinese: 釘鞋掌還能延長鞋子的壽命。

sentences.english: He who has great power should use it lightly.
sentences.chinese: 不可濫權，掌大權者令不輕發。

sentences.english: When we came to power, a part of the country was under the LTTE jackboot .
sentences.chinese: 當我們上臺後，部分國家的猛虎組織掌。

sentences.english: He waves it around before slapping his forehead. "Aaah."
sentences.chinese: 他波，它周圍的前掌摑他的前額。

sentences.english: Before that, palmistry was their preferred method of fortune telling.
sentences.chinese: 此前，他們的首選方式是掌占卜。

sentences.english: Traumatic dislocation of the metacarpophalangeal joint is a relatively uncommon injury.
sentences.chinese: 外傷性脫位的掌指關節是一種相對少見的損傷。

sentences.english: He was holding up one hand. “Gimme five, you rock star.”
sentences.chinese: 他舉起一隻手，“擊個掌吧，你這個大明星。”
我跟一副金馬掌住在一起。

sentences.english: This horse won the golden horseshoes to take me on his back.
sentences.chinese: 這匹馬是因爲把我馱在馬背上才贏得金馬掌的。

sentences.english: The horses were shod with silver and golden bridles .
sentences.chinese: 這些馬釘着金銀做的鉄掌。

sentences.english: Big football clubs in China employed foreign coaches to take charge of their football teams.
sentences.chinese: 足球俱樂部紛紛聘請外籍教練出掌球隊的帥印。

sentences.english: Open reduction for fracture of carpal, tarsal, meta-carpal, meta-tarsal.
sentences.chinese: 腕，跗，掌，跖骨骨折開放性復位術。

sentences.english: The metacarpophalangeal and interphalangeal joints keep in natural flexing position without any active pinching or closing or extending.
sentences.chinese: 手的掌指與指間關節一直保持自然屈曲姿勢。

sentences.english: People always clap for the wrong things.

definition: the five fingers of one's hand
whip or lash/to flog/to whip/conductor's baton/segmented iron weapon (old)/penis (of animal, served as food)
(coll.) foot of an animal or bird/(coll.) foot supporting a cooking pot etc
foot of a bird or animal/paw/claws/talons
lit. to turn over one's palm/fig. everything is going very well.
hand formed into a flat shape, as for a karate chop
